pullRequest.body:
As far as I can tell, this removes all `set_option ... false in norm_num` :tada:

Inspired by the linter in #13653 (but not covered by it yet; so far, that linter only checks the set_option *command*).

---
<!-- The text above the `---` will become the commit message when your
PR is merged. Please leave a blank newline before the `---`, otherwise
GitHub will format the text above it as a title.

To indicate co-authors, include lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Co-authored-by: Author Name <author@email.com>

Any other comments you want to keep out of the PR commit should go
below the `---`, and placed outside this HTML comment, or else they
will be invisible to reviewers.

If this PR depends on other PRs, please list them below this comment,
using the following format:
- [ ] depends on: #abc [optional extra text]
- [ ] depends on: #xyz [optional extra text]
-->

[![Open in Gitpod](https://gitpod.io/button/open-in-gitpod.svg)](https://gitpod.io/from-referrer/)

nodes.body:
### PR summary [66bd80bbd0](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/pull/13704/commits/66bd80bbd0c6df34cd91e9824b1a878ac87a2737)

#### Import changes

No significant changes to the import graph

---

#### Declarations diff

No declarations were harmed in the making of this PR! üêô
<details>
  <summary>You can run this locally as follows</summary>


```bash
## summary with just the declaration names:
./scripts/no_lost_declarations.sh short <optional_commit>

## more verbose report:
./scripts/no_lost_declarations.sh <optional_commit>
```
</details>
!bench

Here are the [benchmark results](http://speed.lean-fro.org/mathlib4/run-detail/d5e64d4f-11a4-44a0-879e-dac5bc00b2d6) for commit 8bb74a888dd4135e21cff568a12d6376775634cc.
There were [significant changes](http://speed.lean-fro.org/mathlib4/compare/9226d529-75d6-457f-8970-4fd6c891597b/to/d5e64d4f-11a4-44a0-879e-dac5bc00b2d6) against commit 491655d43fe6b7f4d326234f429f2f4f10cbf601:
```diff
  Benchmark                                   Metric         Change
  =================================================================
- ~Mathlib.RingTheory.Polynomial.ScaleRoots   instructions    49.6%
```

Lesson learned: these options can be performance-sensitive. Reverted the `ScaleRoots` change and added a comment.
@MichaelStollBayreuth Can I ask you to run your script on the benchmarking run above? I'd like to know if there are any other files with significant regressions. Thank you (that script is really nice - I wish the speed-center also allowed sorting by the absolute change)!

```text
General information:
  build:                                               +19.345 * 10‚Åπ (+0.0159%)

5 files got slower by at least 10‚Åπ instructions:
  Mathlib.RingTheory.Polynomial.ScaleRoots:            +11.369 * 10‚Åπ (+49.6%)
  Mathlib.Analysis.SpecialFunctions.Trigonometric.Bounds:
                                                       +4.1656 * 10‚Åπ (+6.95%)
  Mathlib.Topology.Homotopy.Path:                      +2.7929 * 10‚Åπ (+3.84%)
  Mathlib.Data.Finset.Pointwise:                       +1.8385 * 10‚Åπ (+1.25%)
  Mathlib.RingTheory.Localization.Basic:               +1.4865 * 10‚Åπ (+1.33%)

1 file got slower by at least 10%:
  Mathlib.RingTheory.Polynomial.ScaleRoots:                           +49.6%

2 files got faster by at least 10‚Åπ instructions:
  Mathlib.Analysis.NormedSpace.PiTensorProduct.InjectiveSeminorm:
                                                       -3.9465 * 10‚Åπ (-1.32%)
  Mathlib.Algebra.Category.ModuleCat.ChangeOfRings:    -1.1021 * 10‚Åπ (-0.278%)

No file got faster by at least 10%.
```

I looked at the files which slowed down by more than 10^9 instructions. `ScaleRoots` clearly needs to be reverted (with a comment). The simp call in `Data.Finset.Pointwise` speeds up a lot with that option (250 ->50ms locally), hence I also reverted that. In `Trigonometric/Bounds`, the situation seems murkier (the refine's are slow either way, but perhaps go from 850->800ms)... but I've reverted to try another benchmarking run.
The other changes seems inconclusive or a wash; I tend to leave those in.

So, let's re-benchmark this!
!bench

Here are the [benchmark results](http://speed.lean-fro.org/mathlib4/run-detail/a2872637-b5e5-4b84-aff8-4583f76affa3) for commit 66bd80bbd0c6df34cd91e9824b1a878ac87a2737.
There were [no significant changes](http://speed.lean-fro.org/mathlib4/compare/9226d529-75d6-457f-8970-4fd6c891597b/to/a2872637-b5e5-4b84-aff8-4583f76affa3) against commit 491655d43fe6b7f4d326234f429f2f4f10cbf601.

General information: build: +1.0814 * 10‚Åπ (+0.000889%) 1 file got slower by at least 10‚Åπ instructions: Mathlib.Topology.Homotopy.Path: +2.7944 * 10‚Åπ (+3.84%) No file got slower by at least 10%. 3 files got faster by at least 10‚Åπ instructions: ```text Mathlib.Analysis.NormedSpace.PiTensorProduct.InjectiveSeminorm: -2.1722 * 10‚Åπ (-0.726%) Mathlib.Analysis.SpecialFunctions.Trigonometric.Bounds: -1.9068 * 10‚Åπ (-3.18%) Mathlib.Algebra.Category.ModuleCat.ChangeOfRings: -1.1096 * 10‚Åπ (-0.280%) ``` No file got faster by at least 10%.
bors merge
Already running a review
bors merge

Pull request successfully merged into master.

Build succeeded:
  * [Build](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/9642294386/job/26589765241)
  * [Lint style](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/9642294386/job/26589765749)

```suggestion
  -- The proof works without this option, but *much* slower.
  set_option tactic.skipAssignedInstances false in
  nontriviality S using Subsingleton.eq_zero

pullRequest.title: [Merged by Bors] - chore: remove unnecessary term or tactic `set_option in` with backwards-compatibility flags
